sentence.Network_en: She said goodbye to Hilda with a convincing show of affection.
sentence.Network_cn: 她和希尔达道别时流露出了明显的爱意。

sentence.Network_en: He's only convincing when that inner fury manifests itself.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有在那内心的愤怒充分表露的时候，他才令人信服。

sentence.Network_en: His sales pitch was smooth and convincing.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的推销词流畅又有说服力。

entry.tran: 令人信服的;使人心悦诚服的;有说服力的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as convincing, you mean that they make you believe that a particular thing is true, correct, or genuine.

example.ex: Scientists say there is no convincing evidence that power lines have anything to do with cancer...
example.tran: 科学家们说，并没有确凿的证据表明输电线和癌症之间有什么联系。
他的话听起来很有说服力。

means.word_mean: 1. causing one to believe the truth of something;

auth_sentence.content: I have yet to see one that is convincing.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I have yet to see one that is convincing.

auth_sentence.res_content: But he could be a convincing monster, too.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But he could be a convincing monster, too.

auth_sentence.content: But I fear I was never all that convincing.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 令人心服的;有说服力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: convince[v.[of]使信服,使确信]+ing……的→adj.令人心服的;有说服力的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不可征服的,难以制服的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+vinc征服,克服+ible可..的→不可征服的
con全部+vinc征服,克服+e→彻底征服了对方→使信服,使确信
e出+vinc征服,克服+e→克服障碍,表达感情→使[人]确信

means.word_mean: 令人相信的;有说服力的

sentences.en: The data you have collected is not enough to be convincing.
sentences.cn: 你们收集的材料说服力不足。

sentences.en: This argument seems convincing, but is easily overturned.
sentences.cn: 这个论点好像令人信服，但很容易就被推翻了。
